snippet: The total audience, network executives and political strategists say, could be as high as 100 million viewers — Super Bowl territory....
abstract: First presidential debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump is expected to draw as many as 100 million viewers, record number that would place debate among television's most-watched events; such large audiences are rare in age of increasingly fragmented media.

byline.contributor: Sapna Maheshwari, Amy Chozick and Michael Shear contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The total audience, network executives and political strategists say, could be as high as 100 million viewers — Super Bowl territory.

headline.main: Clinton-Trump Debate Expected to Be Rare Draw in a Polarized Age
headline.print_headline: In Polarized Age, First Debate Is Expected to Be a Rare Draw
